title: Mike Vrabel on AJ Brown, Stefon Diggs’ future and Patriots’ free agency approach
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel discusses free agency plans, focusing on character and talent to improve the roster post-Super Bowl.
Stefon Diggs's future with Patriots uncertain; he's under contract but faces legal issues and carries a guaranteed $6 million bonus.
Vrabel maintains a close personal relationship with Eagles' A.J. Brown despite trade rumors linking Brown to the Patriots.

title: Charania: Jayson Tatum a ‘full-go’ during Celtics’ 5-on-5 scrimmages
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum has been actively participating in Celtics' 5-on-5 scrimmages as he recovers from a ruptured Achilles.
Tatum has no set return date, focusing instead on regaining full strength and mental confidence in his injured leg.
Celtics will clear Tatum for game play only when he indicates readiness, following his accelerated recovery progress.

title: Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Multiple school districts in Cape Cod and southeastern Massachusetts closed through Friday due to power outages and snow cleanup.
Barnstable Public Schools face power restoration delays and logistical challenges, affecting safe transportation and infrastructure readiness.
Plymouth North High School serves as an emergency shelter amid severe storm impacts, with significant local infrastructure issues remaining.

title: Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 26-year-old man was arrested for threatening a passenger with a .40-caliber Beretta on an MBTA bus in East Boston.
The incident occurred around 6 p.m. on a bus traveling on Meridian Street, according to MBTA Transit Police.
The suspect, with a prior illegal firearm possession conviction, removed the gun from his waistband during the confrontation.

title: Explosion and fire at Taunton home seriously injures mother and 2-year-old child
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Explosion at 78 Plain St. in Taunton destroys home, injuring mother and 2-year-old child.
Mother, 25, and child hospitalized with severe injuries; home is a total loss, displacing eight residents.
Cause under investigation by local authorities; two neighboring homes sustained significant damage.

title: Swayman: Team USA ‘should have reacted differently’ to Trump’s joke about US women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman expressed regret over the U.S. men's hockey team's reaction to Trump's joke about the women's team.
Trump jokingly suggested he'd be impeached if he didn't invite the U.S. women's hockey team to Washington D.C.
The U.S. women's hockey team cited prior commitments for declining Trump's invitation to the White House.

title: MSPCA-Angell evacuates nearly 50 animals, opens shelter to pets from Cape homes without power
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MSPCA-Angell evacuated nearly 50 animals from its Cape Cod shelter after a power outage affected the facility.
The evacuated animals, including cats, dogs, and small animals, were relocated to shelters at Nevins Farm and Boston.
MSPCA-Angell's Cape Cod location will temporarily house pets from homes without power due to the recent storm.

title: A small town arts scene in Vermont is among the best in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Stowe, Vermont ranked No. 9 in USA Today's list of best small town arts scenes in America.
Stowe is known for its vibrant arts scene, with galleries and the Spruce Peak Arts performance venue.
The Stowe Foliage Arts Festival is held every fall, during the leaf-changing season, enhancing its cultural appeal.

title: Not in Boston? Your space saver is likely illegal.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Most Massachusetts cities, except Boston, have banned space savers after snowstorms, with some imposing fines up to $100.
Boston allows space savers only during declared snow emergencies and restricted areas remain unaffected, such as Bay Village and South End.
Cambridge, Somerville, and other surrounding areas will remove space savers, emphasizing shared responsibility during winter conditions.

title: ESPN insider has Roman Anthony ranked among MLB’s top-10 corner outfielders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roman Anthony ranked No. 7 among MLB corner outfielders by ESPN insider Buster Olney.
Anthony had a .396 OBP in his rookie season; Boston manager Alex Cora plans to keep him in leadoff spot.
Evaluators suggest Anthony's best position may be center field, despite Red Sox outfield depth.
